Author: Decker#3767
Content: small survey ... how do you think, how many people used our `komodo-qt` in everyday life? question related to upcoming changes since 1.000.000 block ... currently komodo-qt didn't have needed changes in sources for monthly interest claim support and few other things. we didn't see much interest from the community to this wallet. so, the main question is - should we continue to support it? if nobody uses it, should we continue to work on it?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: Unless Agama is planed to eventually have advanced features, I think the qt wallet is highly necessary; however, I could just be biased because I use it daily

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: As to the 2nd part, community interest could have to do with presentation. 99% of the time all people hear is Agama. Granted, it's a flagship product, but I don't think most people even know there is a qt wallet

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
maybe "use" is too strong of a word and I should have said "maintain personal control of"?
Unless I've just missed something, Agama lacks :
the ability to send multiple payments at once 
the ability to control fee expenses
any way to manage UTXOs manually
and
any way to even know what UTXOs you have.
Specifically, to the last bit, Agama is like cramming all of your money in your pocket, buying a coffee, and then shoving all of your money at the cashier and saying "here, you sort it out and give me back whatever change you decide I should have."

Author: jorian#4555
Content: good analogy, i think you're right. but it's the easy solution what most people want. If you buy a 23.49$ coffee and all you have are lots of quarters and dimes, then most people are lazy as fuck and rather shove it, yes.

Author: jorian#4555
Content: the cashier is a computer after all

Author: Decker#3767
Content: What about me - i'm using QT on both platforms: WIndows and Ubuntu, it's very convenient ... and Coin Control Features are "unique". I can simply select an utxo from which i want to send coins. Agama doesn't allow this, and from cli - this is a problem too. Because no utxo field in `sendtoaddress` or other cli commands. In CLI i just can do `lockunspent` to prevent few utxos from being spended. But i can't select an utxo from which i wish to spend from CLI ... and this is not comfortable.

Content: I like QT coin control

Author: Decker#3767
Content: But Qt have other problems ... if you have 20000 utxo with 0.0001 KMD in your wallet - GUI will hang for a couple of minutes to display it )

Author: Decker#3767
Content: That's why it's not recommended to use wallet.dat with very high number of utxos with Qt.

Author: Decker#3767
Content: We will try to update current version of Komodo-Qt to latest codebase (mean `master` of komodod) till half of July. Me or Ocean will inform community about a progress here.

Author: Decker#3767
Content: Nice to hear that our work is important for community.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I am delaying updating master for now. but beta will become master prior to height 1000000

Author: Decker#3767
Content: ohhh ... this will be too hard, i think, to import all current beta changes to komodo-qt ... `komodo-qt` and  `komodod` is **unmergable**, so, updating komodo-qt it not just `git merge` ... it's a hard work to analyze every (!) commit for compatability with komodo-qt. if you just merge `beta` komodod into `master` - i think we don't have time to import all changes. because currently, as i remember, don't contain anything about new assetchains keys and other things. also, as i remember, dev and beta branches have some changes in library usage ... it seems to me it will like a pain ...

Author: Decker#3767
Content: importing in komodo-qt current commits from master - is a one work, but if master will be merged with beta - it's a totally different and more harder work.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, then make the version compatible with master for now. that should work for KMD, just wont work with the new CC enabled chains or chains using new ac options

Author: Decker#3767
Content: yes, this was initial plan ... make `komodo-qt` compatible with current master.
